result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Marie Louis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today December 16, 2015 by 12:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Kayla Marie Louis appeared. Case called at 10:16 a.m. Court received a Motion to Terminate Probation. Atty Andrea gives argument. Requesting restitution be converted into a civil judgment and probation be terminated. Court reminds Atty Andrea that if DEF self revokes, will be set for a sentencing hearing. Court will not make any ruling at this time and allow motion to stand and can be reheard at a future date. Atty Andrea will withdraw motion for now. Court will order that a check be issued to probation for the $50 payment or $50 payment made to the Clerk of Court office can be paid directly to the victim.
Clerk reciepted $50. Did not apply to assessment as DOC collects. Motion pending to terminate probation. ek
Motion hearing at 02-11-2016 10:15 am
to Terminate Probation. Filed by Atty Andrea. km

c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Kayla Marie Louis appeared. Case called at 9:03 a.m. Atty Andrea states there is a resolution and recites the agreement. ADA McKinley in agreement. Victims rights have been complied with. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CM20. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM20. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. State does not oppose expungement. 20 days to appeal.  Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation by 12:00 p.m. today. Bond will continue until reports to probation

- Restitution in the amount of $1,025.49. Paid over the term of probation.

- Court costs payable through probation

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Expungement granted upon successful completion of probation
Filed by Atty Andrea. There is an agreement.
Jury trial at 12-16-2015 08:30 am
